summary: Email correspondence between Assistant U.S. Attorney and attorney Sigrid McCawley regarding Ghislaine Maxwell's defense counsel filing a motion to subpoena information from the Epstein Victim Compensation Fund, and the government's intent to file a motion to quash. Also discusses scheduling for an upcoming call.

persons.name: Sigrid McCawley
persons.context: Recipient of email discussing Maxwell's defense motion to subpoena Epstein Victim Compensation Fund information and scheduling a call.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Her defense counsel filed a motion to subpoena information from the Epstein Victim Compensation Fund.

connections.description: McCawley is involved in legal proceedings concerning Maxwell's defense motion, with the government intending to oppose it.

events.title: Email regarding Maxwell subpoena motion
events.description: Email discusses Maxwell's defense counsel filing a motion to subpoena information from the Epstein Victim Compensation Fund, and the government's intent to file a motion to quash.

locations: United States Attorney's Office Southern District of New York
One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense counsel filed a motion to subpoena information from the Epstein Victim Compensation Fund.
The government (Assistant U.S. Attorney) intends to file a motion to quash the subpoena.
The email discusses scheduling a call to discuss the subpoena and other matters.
The correspondence is marked as confidential and subject to attorney-client privilege protections.
